info.name: Restful-booker Project
info.description: > The **Restful-Booker API** is a lightweight, open-source playground service designed for practicing and demonstrating RESTful API testing. It simulates a hotel booking system, providing endpoints to create, read, update, and delete booking records. This makes it ideal for QA engineers, automation testers, and developers to validate their skills in API automation, authentication handling, and CRUD operations. Link:[https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html)

request.description:
Purpose: Retrieve a single booking record by its unique ID to validate data previously created or to view booking details.

Endpoint: GET {{url}}/booking/:id
Path variables: id = {{bookingid}}

Required environment: Restful-booker_Testing
Required environment variables: url, bookingid, firstname, lastname, totalprice, depositpaid, checkin, checkout, additionalneeds

Example successful response (summary):
- Status: 200 OK
- Body fields: firstname (string), lastname (string), totalprice (number), depositpaid (boolean), bookingdates.checkin (date), bookingdates.checkout (date), additionalneeds (string)
- Sample values recently observed: firstname=Plnan, lastname=Rxllmpi, totalprice=1276, depositpaid=true, bookingdates.checkin=1990-11-04, bookingdates.checkout=1990-12-30, additionalneeds=Lunch

Post-response tests included and what they validate:
- F02 Req02 TC01 (P): Response status is 200
- F02 Req02 TC02 (P): Response time is < 1000 ms
- F02 Req02 TC03 (P): Content-Type header includes application/json
- F02 Req02 TC04..TC10 (P): Response fields match corresponding environment variables (firstname, lastname, totalprice, depositpaid, bookingdates.checkin, bookingdates.checkout, additionalneeds)

How to run (preconditions):
1) Ensure the active environment is Restful-booker_Testing and the variable {{url}} points to the API base URL.
2) Create a booking using request "02.1 Create Booking" to obtain a booking ID.
3) Set the environment variable bookingid to that value (the Create Booking request may already set it).
4) Send this request. The path variable :id resolves from {{bookingid}}.

Troubleshooting tips:
- Error "jsonData is not defined" in tests: Add parsing at the top of the test script, e.g.:
  const jsonData = pm.response.json();
- 404 Not Found: The booking with the provided bookingid does not exist. Verify bookingid is set and valid; run Create Booking first.
- Auth-related failures: If testing endpoints that require auth, ensure any required token/headers are present and not expired.

Notes:
- Collection: Restful-booker Project — see collection link in Postman: collection/30343558-7a39afea-f808-4a7c-a7d2-8b544dd73270
- Workspace: Restful-booker — workspace/0094e6d8-8edd-4658-a2e0-5cdfcd87c102

request.description:
Purpose
Update an existing booking resource by replacing all fields with the provided payload.

HTTP method and endpoint
- Method: PUT
- Endpoint: {{url}}/booking/:id (this request targets id=1)

Required headers and variables
- Headers:
  - Content-Type: application/json
  - Accept: application/json
  - Cookie: token={{token}}
- Variables (from active environment "Restful-booker_Testing"):
  - url, token (used directly in the request)
  - firstname, lastname, totalprice, depositpaid, checkin, checkout, additionalneeds (used for validation in tests and as suggested inputs for the body)

Request body schema (JSON)
{
  "firstname": string,
  "lastname": string,
  "totalprice": number,
  "depositpaid": boolean,
  "bookingdates": {
    "checkin": string (YYYY-MM-DD),
    "checkout": string (YYYY-MM-DD)
  },
  "additionalneeds": string
}

Example request body
{
  "firstname": "{{firstname}}",
  "lastname": "{{lastname}}",
  "totalprice": {{totalprice}},
  "depositpaid": {{depositpaid}},
  "bookingdates": {
    "checkin": "{{checkin}}",
    "checkout": "{{checkout}}"
  },
  "additionalneeds": "{{additionalneeds}}"
}

Expected successful response
- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json
- Body mirrors the updated booking data. Example:
{
  "firstname": "James",
  "lastname": "Brown",
  "totalprice": 111,
  "depositpaid": true,
  "bookingdates": {
    "checkin": "2018-01-01",
    "checkout": "2019-01-01"
  },
  "additionalneeds": "Breakfast"
}

Common errors
- 400 Bad Request: Malformed JSON or missing required fields.
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing/invalid token in Cookie header (token={{token}}).
- 403 Forbidden: Token present but not authorized to modify this booking.
- 404 Not Found: Booking id does not exist.

Testing notes
- This request includes post-response tests that assert:
  - Status code is 200, response time < 1000ms, and Content-Type includes application/json.
  - Response body fields match active environment variables: firstname, lastname, totalprice, depositpaid, bookingdates.checkin, bookingdates.checkout, and additionalneeds.
- Ensure environment variables are set to the intended updated values before sending the request; otherwise, tests like “firstname matches environment variable” will fail (e.g., response shows "James" but env var is different).
- Authentication: Run the "CreateToken" request first to generate and set {{token}} in the environment, then retry this request.
- Tip: After a successful update, you can run "GetBooking by ID" to verify persisted changes.

request.description:
Purpose
Delete an existing booking by its ID.

Endpoint
DELETE {{url}}/booking/:id
- Path variable :id maps to the environment/collection variable {{bookingid}}. Provide a valid numeric booking identifier.

Required headers
- Content-Type: application/json
- Cookie: token={{token}}
  - Authentication: Send a valid auth token as an HTTP cookie named token. Obtain the token using the Create Token request and set it in the active environment (Restful-booker_Testing) as {{token}}.

Sample cURL
curl -X DELETE "{{url}}/booking/{{bookingid}}" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Cookie: token={{token}}"

Expected responses
- 201 Created (Deleted): Booking deletion accepted/successful.
- 403 Forbidden: Missing or invalid token cookie.
- 404 Not Found: Subsequent GET to the deleted booking ID should return 404 after a successful delete.
- 405 Method Not Allowed: Invalid booking ID format or non-existent booking per API behavior.

Response body examples
- Success (201)
  Body: Created
  Content-Type may be text/plain; charset=utf-8 on this API.

- Error (403)
  Body example:
  {
    "error": "Forbidden"
  }

- Error (405)
  Body example:
  {
    "error": "Method Not Allowed"
  }

Notes about tests (post-response)
This request includes automated tests that:
- Assert status code is 201.
- Assert response time < 1000 ms.
- Assert Content-Type includes application/json (note: the API sometimes responds with text/plain; adjust if needed).
- Perform a follow-up GET /booking/{{bookingid}} expecting 404 to confirm deletion.
- Negative checks allow 403 or 405 for cases like invalid/missing token, invalid/non-existent/special-character IDs.

Tips
- Ensure {{url}}, {{bookingid}}, and {{token}} are set in the Restful-booker_Testing environment before sending.
- If you receive 403, refresh the token via the Create Token request and retry.

request.description:
Summary
Retrieve a booking by ID after it has been deleted to confirm the resource no longer exists.

Purpose
This endpoint verifies that a previously deleted booking cannot be retrieved. It should return HTTP 404 Not Found when the booking ID no longer exists.

Method and Path
- Method: GET
- Path: {{url}}/booking/:id
- Path variable(s):
  - id: {{bookingid}} (ID of the booking to fetch)

Required environment variables (from "Restful-booker_Testing")
- url: Base URL of the Restful-Booker service (e.g., https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com)
- bookingid: The booking ID expected to be deleted prior to this request
- token, username, firstname, lastname, totalprice, depositpaid, additionalneeds, checkin, checkout: Present in the environment for broader workflow but not required by this request.

Expected behavior
- When the booking was deleted successfully, this request should return:
  - Status: 404 Not Found
  - Body: "Not Found" (text)

Example responses
- Success (resource not found after deletion)
  - Status: 404 Not Found
  - Body: Not Found
- Error (if booking still exists or flow not followed)
  - Status: 200 OK
  - Body: JSON booking object with fields like firstname, lastname, totalprice, bookingdates, additionalneeds (indicates the booking wasn’t deleted)

Post-response tests (what runs and why)
- F02 Req06 TC01 (P) - Status code is 404 after deletion: Asserts the API returns 404 when the booking is gone.
- F02 Req06 TC02 (P) - Response time is less than 1000ms: Ensures performance is within 1s.
- F02 Req06 TC03 (P) - Response body does not contain booking details fields: Ensures response doesn’t include booking data keywords (firstname, lastname, totalprice).
- F02 Req06 TC04 (N) - Deleted bookingid does not return status 200: Guards against an unexpected 200 OK.
- F02 Req06 TC05 (N) - Deleted bookingid does not return booking object fields: Ensures other booking fields (bookingdates, additionalneeds) are absent.
- Info - Response parsed mode (JSON vs Text) without exceptions: Confirms the script safely handles text or JSON responses without throwing.

Usage notes
- Run this request after successfully deleting a booking (e.g., via "02.5 Delete Booking").
- Ensure environment variable bookingid is set to the deleted booking’s ID.

item.description: > The Booking API is a RESTful service designed to manage hotel bookings. It supports full **CRUD** functionality—Create, Read, Update, and Delete—making it ideal for testing automation flows and validating API behavior.

request.description:
Purpose
- Simple health check endpoint to verify that the Restful-booker service is reachable and responsive.

URL and Method
- Method: GET
- URL: {{url}}/ping

Environment Variable Usage
- {{url}} comes from the active environment (Restful-booker_Testing). Ensure this environment is selected so the base URL resolves correctly.

Example Successful Response
- Status: 201 Created (some implementations may return 200 OK)
- Body: Created
- Headers:
  - Content-Type: text/plain

Expected Status Codes
- 200 OK or 201 Created on success
- 404 Not Found when calling an invalid/unknown endpoint (negative test)

Response Headers
- Content-Type: text/plain or application/json

Request Notes
- No authentication required.
- No request body or query parameters.
- This request is safe to run at any time and is typically used by monitors and smoke tests.

Automated Tests (Post-response script)
- F03 Req01 TC01 (P): Validate response status code is 200 or 201
- F03 Req01 TC02 (P): Validate response time < 500ms
- F03 Req01 TC03 (P): Validate Content-Type is text/plain or application/json
- F03 Req01 TC04 (P): Validate body contains 'Created' or 'OK'
- F03 Req01 TC05 (P): Validate non-empty body
- F03 Req01 TC06 (N): Invalid endpoint can return 404 (health check should not break collection run)
- F03 Req01 TC07 (N): Unsupported method POST should not return 200
- F03 Req01 TC08 (N): Response body should not contain booking data

Links
- Collection: Restful-booker Project (collection/30343558-7a39afea-f808-4a7c-a7d2-8b544dd73270)
- Workspace: Restful-booker (workspace/0094e6d8-8edd-4658-a2e0-5cdfcd87c102)

item.description: > A simple health check endpoint to confirm whether the API is up and running.
